titleInfo.title: Wall Relief, Alexander the Great before Ithyphallic Amen-Re

mods.abstract: Wall relief of Alexander the Great before the Ithyphallic Amen-Re; Amen-Re in three quarter view wears shuty crown and false beard faces Alexander the Great in three quarter view wearing khepresh crown and offers libations to the god; hawk inscription (top left) frames hieroglyphs and cartouches of Alexander the Great, figures surrounded by hieroglyphs and papyrus; "MARER..." inscribed onto wall (lower right corner); untitled print, "541" in pencil on back of print.

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
